Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better We visited Frankfurt to see the Christmas market, and stayed at the Best Western Plaza . The hotel is excellent,in every way, clean,warm and well furnished. Although there were not any coffee/tea facilities in the room, it was available either in the foyer or by room service, free of charge, with biscuits and fruit.As the hotel is 5 minutes walk from the main station, and centre of town, we had a great choice of restaurants for evening meals, so it did not matter that the hotel did not have a restaurant. They did however have a breakfast room and we enjoyed the best breakfast we could have had, with an amazing range of foods.not just the usual Continental breakfast of ham and cheese.The staff spoke English (we do not speak fluent German) and were very helpful.A great hotel and very good value for money even with the falling pound/euro exchange rate .
Reviews.Author: Izzycord

Reviews.Content: Great Value This was the first hotel we booked for our month long triop to Europe. Even though we only stayed one night, we would have been happy to stay longer in this cute little hotel. It was clean and a great location close to the town cente...check ot out.
Reviews.Author: finman101

Reviews.Content: Nice, Quiet, Little Hotel After a long flight from the states, and the train to the Hauptbahnhof, I needed to get rid of my suitcase for the rest of the day. The Plaza Hotel was close to the train station. The staff allowed me to leave my suitcase in the little office as it was only about 9 AM. They also were kind enough to make me a cup of coffee to go at the little lobby bar.Extra charge for breakfast.Tiny elevator.A short walk from the river - perfect for morning walks or evening strolls. On a quiet street, close to a little park. Clean room. My single room was about the size of a single ship cabin. Tiny, but adequate for my one night stay. Only complaint was the shower. Needs a step-over so water doesn't come out onto the floor. Needs shower doors to replace the curtain (which I didn't use because it just blows back into the shower.) Fortunately the entire bathroom is tiled. I prepaid $70 for this room.
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist

Reviews.Content: Clean, but this is the only advantage I've booked two nights for double non-smooking room. As I've arrived late in the night, and they did not have non-smoking room, they put me into a single room, that was the only non-smoking left. The first night I had to spend in the smalles single room I've ever been.. It is actually an upgraded hostel-style hotel, very clean but very basic. Bedlinen old, 1000times washed, with holes, TV-remote-control old, does not work properly.Next night I spent in the double room, was much better, although do not expect any nice double-bed, it is actually two beds put together. Bedlinen the same old stuff.Checking out: they tried to charge me the breakfast, so I pointed out that I've paid for double room, and I had to spend the first night in a single, so I thought breakfast would be complementary. At the end, they did not charge the breakfast, but would have been nice if they offer it.....
Reviews.Author: gulyi88

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Stayed for one night in this hotel in a single room. Room size was quiet small but was very clean and had a verandah and a roomy bathroom. Was 10 minute walk from main train station .Staff were very helpful.Internet cafe just round the corner as well.
Reviews.Author: balmainboy

Reviews.Content: A Great Little Hotel This hotel exactly suited our needs. We planned to base in Frankfurt and take the train daily to other destinations in Germany. The Best Western is about four blocks from the hauptbahnhof (second largest in the world, I'm told) and an easy ten minute walk. We frequently took the walk home at night and saw nothing alarming. The rooms were Europe-small but quite comfortable and ours, located at the back, relatively quiet.. The hotel was clean with polite English speaking personnel. The rate for a double room for six nights was 640 Euros, which I considered quite reasonable. It was a quite enjoyable experience and I recommend the hotel to anyone with goals similar to ours traveling to Frankfurt.I gave it an above average rather than an excellent for the sole reason that the on site breakfast was 12 Euros per person, somewhat high for small-breakfast Americans.
Reviews.Author: hhanover

Reviews.Content: Terrific small hotel       Front of hotel
Reviews.Author: glendale-member

Reviews.Content: Everything you need and comfortable Comfortable hotel, in a reasonable location, with everything you need. Although there is no air-conditioning, each room has a fan and this soon cooled the room down. There is a fridge in the room, drinks available for purchase at reception (or from the mini bar) and complimentary tea and coffee available from reception. The staff were friendly and didn鈥檛 mind making cups of tea when requested. The hotel is probably half way between Frankfurt鈥檚 Museum strip and shops on Zeil Street. It鈥檚 about a 10 minute walk along the river to the museums and Old Town and 15 minutes to Zeil Street. There are a couple of pubs serving food and a pizzeria fairly close by, although we didn鈥檛 try any of these. There is also an internet caf茅 around the corner. We decided to catch a taxi from the airport rather than carry our luggage from the train station. The taxi in the middle of the day cost about 鈧?7 and return to the airport at 7pm was 鈧?3. I would definitely stay at thist hotel again if in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: wal_on_hol

Reviews.Content: The Best Western Plaza was a great hotel I loved staying for one night at the Plaza Best Western in Frankfurt. The staff was so helpful and the breakfast was so good. The room was very clean and quiet. They had gummi bears on the pillow. It was very close to the #12 above ground streetcar, which took you to shopping and historical areas. It rained when we got there and they lent me an umbrella. I thought that was nice. There is a great pastry shop around the corner in front of the University. I would definitely stay there again. If only for the variety of food at breakfast. Yumm! : )
Reviews.Author: pack_y0ur_bags

Reviews.Content: Not as good a value.       Typical bath-Tub and Shower
Reviews.Author: MnViking45

Reviews.Content: good value plaza We booked 2 nights at the beginning of February after reading the reviews on the Trip Advisor website. We were not disappointed. Yes, the hotel may be small but this only adds to its character. The rooms and bathrooms while not overly large were more than adequate. They were clean and bright. The staff could not be more helpful and added to our overall enjoyment. The hotel is very near to the main rail station and not very far from the city centre. This is an above average budget hotel and we would have no hesitation in recommending it as such and very good value for its location. Thanks to all the reviewers for their honest appraisals. Our group consisted of 4 guys.
Reviews.Author: shawshank

Reviews.Content: Great location This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the hauptbanhof (main train station). It was 45 minutes to/from the airport to the door of the hotel for E3.35 each way. Its a block off the river and about a 15 minute walk to Sachsenhausen.The hotel appeared to be completely new inside. Not sure how long ago it was renovated, but it looked very modern and clean. We had 2 rooms, both with two beds (one had a couch for a 3rd person) and balconies. The tv had 3 or 4 English channels. The bath in our room was huge with a full size tub/shower. The other room had just a shower. The elevator was slow (but it had one) so we took the stairs most of the time. No air, but the windows opened and it was nice to have the outside air. There is also a nice comfy down duvet on the bed. The bed was a little more comfortable than many European hotels I've stayed at.Breakfast was more than the typical European breakfast with a good selection of eggs/sausage, croissants, breads, fresh fruit, cheese, cold cut meats, tea, coffee, juices. The front desk staff were very friendly and the lady we made the arrangements with (via email) was most accommodating. We had been advised of this hotel by a fellow coworker who said they were super and he was right.I would suggest this hotel for anyone who wants a place in Frankfurt thats easy to get to (whether staying in Frankfurt for a while or just overnighting).
Reviews.Author: tadjr

Reviews.Content: Great for a One Night Stay We arrived into Frankfurt in the late afternoon after getting our car at the airport. Only a 20 minute drive with some good directions from the lady behind the Alamo rental car desk. There is street parking but you'll have to grab it early. Since there wasn't any by the time we got to the hotel, we asked to park the car in the Best Western Plaza garage. This is available for an addition 8 or 10 euro (I don't exactly remember how much). The only thing is, whenever you want to get your car in or out of the garage, you have to ask the receptionist to open the garage door. It isn't too much trouble unless the receptionist isn't behind the front desk!The room on the other hand was great. We asked for 2 double rooms near each other which is what we received. The room was big in resepect to european standards. The beds were perfect, I had a good night's sleep on it. The bathroom was pretty spacious with a towel warming rack. The shower was decent, had great pressure and hot water was always available. A fan was provided in our rooms for us to use also. There's also a standard hairdryer which I was so happy to see (instead of those vaccum type that were in both hotels we stayed at in Italy)!All in all, this is a perfect place for one or two nights. If we're ever in Frankfurt again, we'll probably look this place up again.
Reviews.Author: SJhulawahine

Reviews.Content: Great place - great price - great breakfast We flew to Frankfurt from SFO and wanted to stay near the train station. We chose the Best Western Plaza and we were thrilled. It's just a short walk from the train station (about 10 mns). It's very near the center and you can walk everywhere while still on a quiet street. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast buffet is awesome! I would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Clotilde98

Reviews.Content: Reasonable stay at Plaza Stayed here for 2 nights during recent World Cup. Price was high accordingly and room only. For the same reason we had a non cancellable reservation, ok. I was surprised that I had been charged that day prior to my arrival and was presented with this on arrival.When I asked for some soft drinks the front desk lady advised buying at a small store near by as it would be much cheaper than in the hotel, unusual honesty! The same lady was most helpful when I rquested a fan given the heat, the fan was mentioned on the in room details. She brought it up quickly. The fan was more use than some supposed Air Con at some more upmarket hotels we used on the trip.We wanted 2 keys which required them to re cut the lock on the door, the same lady did this too in about 5 mins! Small secure open Car Park, chargeable, behind hotel with a covered garage also. Access just past hotel as you approach it on right.Walk to the centre didn't take too long and was pleasant in the nice weather when taken along the river. Hotel convenient for the main station. Location was quiet, room clean.Main complaint would be limited storage space but especially being charged on a presumption of having eaten breakfast. I travel quite a lot and this has happened to me at Holiday Inns and Best Westerns before. They had even had the cheek to ring it up before showing me the bill. There were 2 of us so it was 4 x 11euros for the 2 nights. The lady, different to the heroine above!, was not particularly gracious about recrediting it although that has worked since on my bill.Whether I would have noticed had I not already have paid the sizeable accommodation bill is a moot point. I wonder how many breakfasts they don't provide and charge for during the year that folk don't notice when its a smaller part of the bill?Nice German restaurant and bar left out of hotel and right at top of the street. Good choice of food at fair prices, an excellent beer selection and friendly service.
Reviews.Author: smjak02

Reviews.Content: Good Value Booked a room direct with the hotel for 4 nights for 268 Euros. Not a bad price, but I actually paid extra for a studio. The room I was assigned was small, with two twin beds, a desk, two desk chairs, and a small bathroom. To me, a studio hotel room is more of a small suite, with a couch. When I questioned this with the desk clerk, I was told no, I was in a large room which is a studio. I wasn't upset, since the 67 Euros a night was still a good deal. I'll just know better next time, and will e-mail to get a room description.That said, I would highly recommend this hotel for a Frankfurt stay. It's 4-5 blocks from the train station, it's very clean, and everything (carpet, furnishings, etc.)appears to be only a couple of years old. It reminded me of a Hampton Inn -- nothing fancy, but very clean and functional, and a good value. It can, however, be a little difficult to find if you don't have a good map. If you are arriving by train or plane, I would suggest taking a taxi to the hotel the first time. Then you can get your bearings. Oh, and to follow up on a previous reviewer who mentioned how hot their room was during the summer, please note this property is not air conditioned. Don't expect cool rooms during the summer.
Reviews.Author: Tom99

Reviews.Content: Fine but... I stayed three nights in this hotel and I have to say it's quite nice, clean, modern, good breakfast... But something happened to me which makes me not reccomend this hotel. I payed for my stay in advance when I arrived and I used my Visa Card, ok. But when I was back home and my bank sent my visa charges, I realised that I had two anotations from the hotel: the 3 nights in a double room (264 鈧? and another one of 30鈧?I didn't sing or know about. I contact them and they said that I had taken drinks and staff from the minibar and didn't tell them when I left. It is not true! They are wrong, I didn't take anything but I cannot prove it. I told them, but they say they have check the matter and that they are not goin to refund my money. I am still trying to solve this problem through my bank. It makes me furious that they can charge what they want, do not trust my word and I cannot do anything.So make sure your minibar is full at your arrival or they'll make you pay for nothing as it happened to me.
Reviews.Author: belaso

Reviews.Content: Great location, great little hotel We (2 adults  2 teens) recently spent one day and night in Frankfurt and thanks to previous comments on tripadvisor, we found the Best Western a wonderful stop in our travels! We did take the train in from the airport and had no problem finding the location, thanks to the map we found on the hotel website and a street sign directing us. The hotel is nicely situated on a quieter street just a block in from the river and only about a 15 minute train ride from the airport. It is, at most, a 15 minute walk from the station..however it is a large station with shops and stairs ect...we travelled with small suitcases so it was easy. The hotel rooms were very clean, modern and quiet with wonderful, helpful staff. And yes, we too found the rooms a little hot at night until we were treated to an amazing thunder and lightening storm which thankfully cooled the rooms down too. We loved our stroll along the Maine River to downtown (about 20-30 minutes) and enjoyed the beautiful old buildings in the very lively main square. Unfortunately the suggested german restaurant on the corner was closed for holidays but the friendly front desk staff directed us to another restaurant on the south side (old part of the city on the other side of the bridge) called Schanke on Schweizer Street. This is an old german beer parlour with a lovely, casual inner courtyard restaurant. The food was tasty and the atmosphere wonderful! This hotel, so convienent from the airport and close enough to downtown, is a great location to enjoy a short stay. We would definetly book at the Best Western Plaza again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Reliable the second time around This hotel is about a 6minute walk to the Frankfurt Hbf. We always walk. It is also about a block from the river which makes for great strolls and jogging. This is my second time staying at this hotel with my children. The rate was great enough that we got two huge rooms. We skipped their breakfast option because we love walking around and getting our own pastries, but if you want the convenience of staying in, their breakfast is very delightful. I also like the free espresso they make for you at the counter (if you ask for it). It is located on a side street in a residental area from the busy road that goes by the train station, so it affords you a little more peace and quiet. I recommend the restaurant/pub on the corner for some good old fashioned German cooking.They do a great job with the cleaning. The rooms are of a good size. If you get a corner room, it has two twin beds and a daybed type of couch so you could easily have a child/teen sleep on that and not be too crowded.We took the train from the airport (15 min ride) to the station and just walked from there. Maybe take a cab if you brought overpacked, large bags. If you haven't been to Europe before and bring large, overpacked bags...you will learn a lesson not to do that again.The hotel is close to the bus lines, but beware that they stop running about 7 or 8pm. Keep that in mind if you enjoy the nightlife activities.You can easily (and should) walk the entire strip of museums along the river. It is a beautiful stroll. Otherwise, the bus stop on the corner from the hotel can take you the few blocks away you need to see them all.Nice, affordable hotel. Would stay there again....and problably will.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lots of space, modern, but ask for directions from the train station! Stayed at the BW Plaza in September, 2004. Great staff, large spacious room, very nice. Breakfast room is very good, though a bit cramped. Staff made a great recommendation for dinner close to hotel. Only 1 thing to be aware of...the website says this hotel is 200 meters from Frankfurt Main rail station. It is NOT! It is more like 500 meters from the station entrance. Easily a 10-15 minute walk. It IS 200 m from the rail tracks that lead to the station! Ask for directions, I got lost trying to find this hotel and that wasn't much fun after an all day journey from Austria.
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler032003

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel We stayed at the Best Western Plaza hotel for two nights in mid September 04. We thought it was a great little hotel, staff very pleasant and the breakfast absolutely A1. We did not have the experience of the room being hot as the weather had cooled down - we were able to open the windows and a door to a small balcony which was a great asset. Furnishings and the bathroom very modern. All in all a very pleasant stay. Our one comment has to be that they only had duvets on the bed. While it wasn't very hot, it was still too hot for duvets. Luckily we had bought a top sheet at another stopover in Europe with the same problem and we were able to get a good night's rest.We would recommend however if going to the hotel from the railway station that you obtain very precise directions - we did get lost!
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but hot! Got a great deal on the Best Western Plaza in Frankfurt (50 euros) - nice hotel, helpful staff, within walking distance of the main rail station and about a 15-20 minute walk to the city centre. However, the hotel was severely lacking in the air conditioning department and the room was unbelievably hot in the middle of June.
Reviews.Author: bookgal

Reviews.Content: The Maine River Walking along the track of the maine river gives you a feeling that life can be pleasant if we also moved like maine river. The water is clean , and not at all turbulent, peaceful flow of the water makes it feel that our lives also should be like maine river which flows all along taking with it the people on the boat in a peaceful co-existant . Maine river the heart line of Frankfurt depicts the flow of the life of Frankfurt. The Best Western Plaza Hotel at Frankfurt also turned out ot be an excellent hotel. The Front desk manager an excellent and courteous staff work out everything for you. Its great stay at The Best Western Plaza . Its worth the stay.
Reviews.Author: Nerkunam

Reviews.Author: Binel
